Prompt Level: 16-Upper Advanced [SEP] Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: In the mystical landscapes of India, the elusive "Brahmaputra Banshee" is a legendary creature whispered of in hushed tones. Said to inhabit the misty banks of the mighty Brahmaputra River, this ethereal spirit is known for its hauntingly melodic wails that echo through the night, captivating the imagination of those who hear it.

Described as a spectral being with flowing silver hair and luminescent skin, the Brahmaputra Banshee is often seen during twilight, when the river is cloaked in a veil of fog. Locals believe that her wails, though eerie, possess a melancholic beauty, telling tales of lost love and forgotten souls. Some say she is the spirit of a princess who drowned in the river centuries ago, forever bound to its waters. Her presence is both feared and revered; while her song is said to bring misfortune, it also serves as a warning of impending floods or natural disasters.

Fishermen and villagers along the river offer small tributes to appease her, hoping for safe passage and bountiful catches. The legend of the Brahmaputra Banshee continues to be an integral part of the region's folklore, a mystical reminder of the river’s enduring mysteries.

Prompt Level: Sciences [SEP] Prompt: Write a description, introducing the new bird species, comparing its appearance and habitat to that of the American robin, and classification using the formal zoological classification system. For the classification, suggest a name for the new species and say why it’s suitable. Use the email as reference. [SEP] Response: A new bird species closely related to the American robin has been discovered following DNA testing of various flocks previously thought to be robins. This new species shows significant differences in both appearance and behavior while still inhabiting similar terrains.
Appearance: The new species is slightly smaller than the American robin and has a larger bill. The male's coloring is rustier and less red compared to the vibrant red breast of the American robin.
Habitat: This species shares the same general habitat as the American robin but differs in its migratory patterns. Unlike the American robin, which winters in southern regions, this new species remains in Canada year-round.
Classification:
•	Kingdom: Animal
•	Phylum: Chordate
•	Class: Bird
•	Order: Passeriformes
•	Family: Turdidae
•	Genus: Turdus
•	Species: Turdus canadensis (proposed name)
The name Turdus canadensis is suggested to reflect its Canadian habitat and distinguish it from the more migratory American robin (Turdus migratorius). This name emphasizes its geographic range and subtle differences from its close relative.

Prompt Level: 16-Upper Advanced [SEP] Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: Buying a home and applying for a home loan in my country can be both exciting and challenging, depending on your financial situation and understanding of the process. The overall process isn’t difficult, but it can be time-consuming and requires patience. First, securing a home loan usually involves filling out several forms, including proof of income, credit history, and employment status. Depending on the lender, the process can be overwhelming, especially for first-time buyers. While there are plenty of forms to fill out, many lenders offer online applications that streamline the paperwork.

Housing prices in my country have risen significantly in recent years, making it difficult for many to afford homes, especially in urban areas. Prices vary by location, but in major cities, they tend to be on the higher end, making homeownership seem out of reach for many people. As for interest rates, they are generally around 3-5%, depending on the lender and the borrower’s credit score. Interest rates can fluctuate, so it’s important to shop around for the best deal.
While it’s possible to buy a home without a real estate agent or mortgage broker, many people choose to work with them. A real estate agent can help navigate the housing market and find suitable properties, while a mortgage broker can assist in finding the best loan options and interest rates.

Prompt Level: Maritime [SEP] Prompt: Write an email to your family to let them know your vessel is going to ride out a storm at sea. Write 100-150 words. Type in the input box. [SEP] Response: FROM:  Captain EF Student
TO: Dear Family Members

SUBJECT:  SEVERE HURRICANE AT SEA

I would like to advise you that our journey has been delayed due to warnings we have received from the Maritime News agency.

Our vessel is going to ride out a storm At Latitude 320 and Longitude 50 degrees Southeast. The department of safety has warned us against proceeding, and we have ballasted down the vessel.

We have put water in the ballast tank in order to secure the cargo and we have secured the vessel with lines to a fixed point on shore to secure it against the winds.
We have also lashed the cargo securely and we hope by end of the next 24 hours we shall be able to proceed with the journey.

Do not worry, we are safe.

REgards

Prompt Level: Law [SEP] Prompt: Rewrite the termination section of the contract to take into account possible discrimination either against or by the employer or employee. Compare your amendment with the model. This is a non-graded activity. [SEP] Response: Termination of Employment (Revised)
7.1. Upon completion of the probationary period set out in paragraph 4, Party A may terminate Party B’s employment under the following conditions:

(a) For just cause at common law, including serious misconduct or breach of duty, provided such termination is not based on discriminatory grounds or in retaliation for complaints of discrimination or harassment. In this case, no advance notice or compensation in lieu of notice shall be required.

(b) Without just cause, in which case Party A shall provide Party B with written advance notice or compensation in lieu of notice equal to one (1) month plus two (2) weeks for each year of completed service with Party A, up to a maximum of fifteen (15) months.

7.2. Party B may terminate their employment at any time by giving Party A at least eight (8) weeks’ written notice.

7.3. Termination, whether by Party A or Party B, must not be based on discriminatory practices, including but not limited to race, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable human rights or labor legislation.

7.4. If either party believes that discrimination or harassment contributed to the termination, or to a working environment that led to resignation, the matter may be referred to mediation or to an appropriate labor or human rights tribunal for review. Both parties agree to cooperate in good faith with any resulting investigation or proceeding.

Best regards,  
Helena

Prompt Level: Police and Immigration [SEP] Prompt: Now prepare the content for an informative web page about counterfeit goods. Be sure to keep the following points in mind: Types of counterfeit goods, the effect of counterfeiting on society, the signs of a fake, what to do if you discover fake goods.  Write 250-300 words. [SEP] Response: **Understanding Counterfeit Goods: What You Need to Know**

Counterfeit goods are fake products made to look like genuine items, often sold at a lower price to deceive consumers. These items can range from luxury fashion and electronics to everyday items like cosmetics, toys, medicines, and even car parts. While some people may view counterfeits as a harmless bargain, the reality is far more serious.

**Types of Counterfeit Goods**

Counterfeits can include:

* **Clothing and accessories** (branded handbags, shoes, and watches)
* **Electronics** (phones, chargers, batteries)
* **Pharmaceuticals** (fake medicines and health supplements)
* **Cosmetics and personal care products**
* **Toys and baby products**
  These goods are often produced in unregulated factories using unsafe materials.

**The Effect on Society**

Counterfeiting poses major risks:

* **Health and Safety**: Fake goods, especially medicines or electronics, can be dangerous and even life-threatening.
* **Economic Impact**: Counterfeiting harms legitimate businesses, reduces tax revenues, and leads to job losses.
* **Organized Crime**: Profits from counterfeit sales often fund illegal activities and organized crime.

**How to Spot a Fake**

Here are some common signs of counterfeit products:

* Prices that are unusually low
* Poor quality materials or misspelled brand names
* Missing serial numbers, holograms, or authenticity seals
* Unfamiliar packaging or labeling

**What to Do If You Discover Fake Goods**

* **Do not purchase or use the item.**
* **Report it** to the brand owner, retailer, or local consumer protection agency.
* **Avoid sharing or promoting** counterfeit products on social media or online marketplaces.

By staying informed and cautious, you can help protect yourself and others from the dangers of counterfeit goods.

Prompt Level: IT Industry [SEP] Prompt: Write an email to the client, informing them of the sections that you have not yet received information on, highlight the importance of the information and request that it be provided as soon as possible. Use the notes to help you. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Caía uma chuva miúda, quase pó! A luz mortiça dos candeeiros deixava antever traços finos e oblíquos de água fria. Alcina refugiou-se debaixo do toldo de uma velha loja de ferragens, fechada havia muitos anos. A noite não estava convidativa mas havia sempre quem estivesse disposto a comprar felicidade falsa e prazer duvidoso.

Tal como o antigo patrão que a iniciara naquela vida… Uma vida perdida ou talvez não. Doutra forma estaria, aos 36 anos, rodeada de um rancho de filhos que tinha de sustentar, um marido bêbado para aturar, o gado para tratar e as terras para amanhar.

Parou um carro. Saiu da cobertura, aproximou-se da janela que desceu lentamente. Entre sorrisos, disparou um costumado cumprimento:

- Boa noite, sortudo…

- Sortudo?

- Sim! Vejo que queres companhia. E estou aqui para te ajudar…

As frases eram invariavelmente as mesmas, proferidas naquele tom meloso de provocação libidinosa. Afastou-se do carro um pouco para que a apreciasse. O condutor não gostou do que viu e sem nada dizer, arrancou.

Mais à frente duas jovens tiveram mais sorte e entraram na viatura.

Alcina nem pestanejou. Já sabia que era assim. A sua idade trazia-lhe profundos sulcos na face, que nem as camadas de base conseguiam disfarçar.

Todavia o corpo parecia menos mau, assim julgava. Vestia nessa noite uma minisaia curta que mais parecia um cinto. Um top cotado e meias de renda. Por cima, um casaco comprido de um vermelho berrante mas atractivo.

Regressou ao toldo e sentou-se no degrau frio e molhado. Encostou a cabeça à parede e adormeceu. Nesse sono acabou por viajar ao seu passado, umas vezes fantástico, outras nem tanto. Parecia sentir ainda o cheiro do pão acabado de cozer e outrossim do corpo gordo e mal-cheiroso do velho que a possuíra pela primeira vez. Aquele sono levou-a de regresso à sua antiga escola, onde as letras e os números a animavam. E à mãe que desejava colocar a filha a estudar mas o pai, austero e avaro, só pretendia dinheiro.

Sentiu um toque muito ao de leve no ombro. Acordou sobressaltada e deu de caras com um jovem rapaz que a mirava. Perguntou:

- Não achas que és muito novo para andares às meninas?

O jovem voluntário olhou para os colegas ao lado e sorriu. Insistiu:

- Posso ajudá-la nalguma coisa?

Alcina percebendo finalmente o equívoco, respondeu:

- Hum, só gostava de voltar a ser feliz!

It has been brought to my attention on a number of occasions recently that, despite my repeated verbal warnings, you are continuing to violate the company’s dress code. Therefore it is with great regret that I am forced to issue you this formal written warning.

I am sure that you recall my previous verbal warning one month ago, during which I told you if you didn’t comply with the dress code I would be forced to take things further. This has quite simply gone on long enough.

I would like to make this clear: This is your final warning on this matter.

Prompt Level: Correspondence [SEP] Prompt: You see a niche in the hotel market and decide to write a business proposal for investors. Write the **strategic summary** and **risk assessment** sections of the proposal using the notes. Write 140–200 words. [SEP] Response: Strategic Summary

Zen will be a premium boutique hotel combining spa, wellness, and fitness services in one elegant retreat. Backed by $4 million in investment, the project targets the fast-growing market for weekend getaways and wellness-focused travel, as highlighted in recent AccomData Group research. Unlike standard fitness resorts, Zen will offer a gourmet health-focused menu curated by renowned chefs, responding directly to consumer dissatisfaction with food quality in current fitness centers.

With state-of-the-art gyms, pools, and professional wellness instructors, Zen positions itself as the top-tier choice for health-conscious travelers. Construction is expected to take two years. We anticipate return on investment by the second operational year and annual profits of approximately $1 million from then on. Full investment recovery is projected within four years of opening.

Risk Assessment

We have already accounted for potential economic downturns in our projections. Should the market remain stable, both ROI and profit timelines may be halved. A robust media campaign by Kudos Advertising Agency will ensure market awareness and early traction.

Prompt Level: Military [SEP] Prompt: Listen to a liaison officer advise a military unit prior to a VIP visit. Make notes on the main points. Compare your text with the model. This is a non-graded activity. [SEP] Response: Present Perfect

Form
We make the present perfect tense with the verb have and the past participle of the main verb.

Look at the following sentences:

Positive statement:  I have marched.  /  He has marched. (I've marched. He's marched.)

Negative statement:  I have not marched (I haven't marched).  /  He has not marched (He hasn't marched).

Question:  Have you marched?

Negative question:  Have you not marched? (Haven't you marched?)

Usage

We use the present perfect tense to refer to events in the past which are either finished or unfinished. The time period is unfinished, has just finished or is unspecified.

Look at these examples:

We've been on exercise for days. (The exercise is still continuing, but the exact time period is unspecified.)

I’ve just seen the convoy leaving camp.  (The action has finished. The time period has just finished.)

I’ve been in the Air Force for 6 years and I want to stay until it’s time to retire. (The action hasn’t finished. The time period hasn’t finished.)

Present Perfect vs. Past Simple

The present perfect tense can be contrasted with the past simple. The past simple is used with finished periods of time.

Look at this example:
The exercise started on Monday and we’ve had three casualties so far.

The first part of the sentence is in finished time and uses the simple past. In the second part the time is unfinished and uses the present perfect.

Prompt Level: Sciences [SEP] Prompt: Write a description, introducing the new bird species, comparing its appearance and habitat to that of the American robin, and classification using the formal zoological classification system. For the classification, suggest a name for the new species and say why it’s suitable. Use the email as reference. [SEP] Response: Nova Espécie de Ave Descoberta – Um Parente Próximo do Pisco-de-Peito-Ruivo-Americano

Testes de DNA recentes revelaram uma nova espécie de ave que anteriormente se acreditava ser o pisco-de-peito-ruivo-americano (Turdus migratorius). Embora geneticamente relacionada, essa nova espécie identificada apresenta diferenças importantes tanto na aparência quanto no habitat.

Fisicamente, ela é um pouco menor que o pisco-de-peito-ruivo-americano e possui um bico visivelmente maior. A plumagem do macho tem um tom mais enferrujado, com menos vermelho no peito do que o habitual nessa outra espécie. Essas características sutis, mas consistentes, ajudam a diferenciá-la em campo.

Embora habite ambientes semelhantes, a nova espécie apresenta um comportamento diferente durante o inverno. Ao contrário do pisco-de-peito-ruivo-americano, que migra para o sul do Canadá, essa ave permanece no país durante todo o ano — uma diferença ecológica importante.

Usando o sistema formal de classificação zoológica, a nova espécie é classificada da seguinte forma:

Reino: Animalia

Filo: Chordata

Classe: Aves

Ordem: Passeriformes

Família: Turdidae

Gênero: Turdus

Espécie: Turdus canadensis


O nome sugerido, Turdus canadensis, destaca a forte associação da espécie com o Canadá, especialmente seu comportamento não migratório. Esse nome homenageia seu habitat no norte e ajuda a diferenciá-la de seu parente migratório mais comum.

"How are you?" e "How's it going?": Formas comuns de perguntar "como vai?" em inglês. 
"What's your name?" e "My name is...": Frases básicas para se apresentar. 
"Nice to meet you": Uma forma educada de dizer "prazer em conhecê-lo(a)". 
"Excuse me": Usado para chamar a atenção de alguém ou pedir desculpas por algo. 
"I'm sorry" e "You're welcome": Expressões comuns de arrependimento e resposta a "obrigado". 
"Thank you": Agradecimento em inglês. 
"That's okay": Uma resposta para dizer que está tudo bem, ou que não há problema.
"I don't understand" e "Can you repeat that?": Frases úteis para quando você não entendeu algo. 
"What time is it?" e "What day is it?": Perguntas sobre tempo. 
"I'm fine, thank you": Uma resposta padrão para "How are you?". 
"See you later", "Have a good day", "Good morning", "Good afternoon", "Good evening": Frases comuns de despedida e saudação.

Working long hours and sitting at your desk all day is causing physical strain—particularly back pain—which is likely worsened by a poor-quality chair. This sedentary routine, combined with smoking, high coffee intake, and lack of sleep, is contributing to your constant fatigue and stress. Additionally, your reliance on junk food and lack of physical activity is having a negative impact on your weight and overall energy levels.

To start making changes, I recommend replacing one coffee per day with a glass of water, taking regular breaks from your desk, and considering light daily exercise such as walking or stretching. Improving your diet by including more fresh fruits and vegetables will boost your energy and mood. Lastly, cutting down on screen time before bed can greatly improve your sleep quality.

Small adjustments will lead to big improvements over time. Reducing stress, eating better, and staying active will help you feel more energized, focused, and in control of your health.

Let me know if you'd like help setting goals.

Life Coach

Prompt Level: Automotive [SEP] Prompt: Now write a report comparing the two car designs. Which design do you think you should go with? Persuade your design team to choose one of the designs for next year’s rollout. Write 100-150 words. [SEP] Response: In today’s fast-paced automotive market, making the right car buying decision can be like navigating a complex maze. With numerous brands, models, specifications, options, colors, packages, and prices to consider, potential car buyers often find themselves overwhelmed by choices.

JATO’s recent survey of 2,500 future car buyers revealed that 29% of people would research online first when buying a new car. This is where car comparison tools can prove to be essential for securing new and repeat business on automotive websites.
1) Streamlining decision-making process
Imagine a customer is in the market for a hatchback and they’re looking at your brand. There are many things for them to consider – from price points to specification requirements – so having the right information is crucial to support the sales journey.

 

Using a car comparison tool, they can effortlessly access the facts they need, compare your model offering against direct competitors and evaluate specifications side by side. From engine performance and fuel efficiency to safety features and advanced technology, they will have a comprehensive overview that highlights key advantages and differences.

 

This information gives customers clarity and helps to simplify the decision-making process.
 Enhancing transparency and trust
Transparency is a cornerstone of modern business practices. By offering a car comparison tool, your brand can demonstrate its commitment to providing potential buyers with an honest and unbiased evaluation of their offerings. This fosters trust and reinforces the brand’s credibility – both crucial factors in building lasting customer relationships, recommendations, and repeat business.

 

3) Customisation tailored to individual preferences
Car comparison tools go beyond listing features. They allow potential buyers to explore the various options, colours, and packages available for each model. This means that a buyer can seamlessly experiment with different specifications according to their preferences, budget, and what is available in the market today.

 

According to JATO’s recent research, the top options people like to add if they have remaining budget are safety features (parking sensors, lane assist etc.). Therefore, a car comparison tool that allows customers to compare safety options from multiple brands – from price to capability – can enhance the customer experience.

 

Offering high levels of customisation and direct access to information gives the car buyer more power, ensuring that the final purchase aligns with their preferences and requirements.

 

4) Offering a digital first experience
The car buying journey has previously involved extensive research, various dealership visits, and test drives. Today, car comparison tools enable brands and customers to streamline the initial research phase, saving valuable time and energy. Customers browsing your website can now conveniently access all the information they need in one place, making the process more efficient and increasing customer satisfaction.

Prompt Level: 11-Upper Intermediate [SEP] Prompt: Write a paragraph about how media has changed in your lifetime. What media was important before? What do you use now, and how has it changed your reading habits? Pay attention to your use of commas, colons and semicolons. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: Media has dramatically transformed my life over the years: from the way I consume information to the pace at which I receive it. Initially, my primary sources of news were newspapers and television broadcasts, which provided scheduled updates and limited viewpoints. However, the advent of the internet, along with the proliferation of smartphones, has revolutionized my interaction with media. Now, I have constant, on-demand access to a vast array of resources, from online articles and videos to podcasts and social media platforms. This shift has made staying informed both more comprehensive and overwhelming; it's easy to fall into information overload. Social media, in particular, has blurred the lines between personal and public spaces, facilitating instant communication but also raising concerns about privacy and misinformation. Furthermore, the personalized algorithms on platforms like YouTube and Twitter curate content tailored to my interests, which can be both a boon and a curse; while it ensures relevancy, it can also create echo chambers that reinforce my existing beliefs. Thus, while media has undoubtedly enhanced my ability to connect with the world, it also demands a higher level of discernment to navigate it responsibly.

Prompt Level: Police and Immigration [SEP] Prompt: Ms. Smith, a member of the neighborhood watch group, has contacted your department asking for information on how to deal with domestic abuse. Write her an email summarizing the information from the SOADA flyer, and encourage her to contact the organization. [SEP] Response: We are often told to just say “no” to drugs, and that's excellent advice. Drugs have various adverse effects on individuals and society. Besides the obvious health dangers of taking drugs, there are many other ways in which drugs negatively impact our communities.

Many people think that their own health is their own business, but perhaps you didn’t know that drug use also contributes to the spread of HIV. This can be caused by the sharing of drug needles, but HIV is also spread as a result of the impaired abilities of users to make good judgments. Drug users often engage in unprotected sex, which then transmits HIV to several people in a short period of time.

Closely related to this is the burden that drugs have on the health care system, since so much money and resources are spent treating drug addicts, victims of drug-related violence, and others whose health is affected by the illegal drug trade.

Drug use also brings about great economic losses in the community. Drug users tend to have lower productivity at work, or they miss work altogether, costing companies millions of dollars per year. Additionally, millions of dollars are spent every year fighting drug cartels and drug smugglers.

All of the fighting between drug cartels, drug smugglers, and the authorities not only results in millions of dollars in property and infrastructure damage, but also increased violent crime in our neighborhoods. Drug users are often violent as a result of the influence of drugs or the influence of their desire for them.

Related to this is the funding of militant groups that comes as a result of drug trafficking. These groups sometimes commit acts of violence and terrorism in order to establish their dominance and take control of the drug trafficking industry.

Finally, even when we do capture those responsible for selling or importing drugs, the justice system becomes burdened as a result of having to deal with the perpetrators of drug-related crimes.
